description: Port Royal, Jamaica, was struck by a devastating earthquake.
detail_1: The earthquake caused a tsunami that flooded the town.
detail_2: Much of the city sank into the sea, leading to its abandonment as a major port.
image_prompt: Illustration of Port Royal, Jamaica before the 1692 earthquake, showing ships in the harbor and buildings along the coast, 17th century style, sunny day
audio_text: On June 7, 1692, Port Royal, Jamaica, was struck by a devastating earthquake. The earthquake caused a tsunami that flooded the town. Much of the city sank into the sea, leading to its abandonment as a major port.

audio_text: On June 7, 1864, Abraham Lincoln was nominated for a second term as President of the United States by the Republican Party. The nomination took place during the Civil War. The Republican Party temporarily renamed itself the National Union Party to attract support from War Democrats.

description: Norway declared its independence from Sweden.
detail_1: The Norwegian Parliament, the Storting, unilaterally declared the union with Sweden dissolved.
detail_2: This action was later confirmed by a plebiscite, leading to full recognition of Norway as an independent nation.
image_prompt: A crowd of Norwegians celebrating Norway's declaration of independence in 1905, waving Norwegian flags, Oslo street scene, early 20th century
audio_text: On June 7, 1905, Norway declared its independence from Sweden. The Norwegian Parliament, the Storting, unilaterally declared the union with Sweden dissolved. This action was later confirmed by a plebiscite, leading to full recognition of Norway as an independent nation.
